place_description: This cheerful gathering place draws a crowd for its pastries, light fare & coffee drinks.

reviews_data.review_text: Super cool little bistro with a hip vibe. A couple was here dressed to the nines and taking pictures in the awesome decor (though it would have been nice if they weren't in the way of people actually buying and eating things). Great food, the desserts on point, and the tartlets do travel well crosscountry!
A nice pastry shop and cafe with sidewalk seating to enjoy your beverage and relax watching the world like a true Parisian cafe and patisserie
Great selection of bakery. Veggie quiche a tad oily otherwise tasty. Love the decor and motif.

The only French about this place was the music in the restroom. The rest is American -  greasy food, pastries are super sweat, depressing atmosphere inside. Tried to find good coffee place in Charlotte based on reviews and this one was a mistake
amazing coffee and pastries. the cafe is almost a tourist attraction in its self ! It's an extremely unique place !

Really disappointed. Have come here for a year and order the same thing every. Sadly, something has changed with the torts. Parts of the shell are soggy. The strawberries are water logged and also soggy. This was within a few minutes of ordering. You can see the ring in the box from the wet ring under the tort.
Great breakfast location in downtown Charlotte. A lot of seating inside and out. Great service and great food. Is within walking distance of a lot of hotels in the area. Great experience.
The macarons were great when I went, and the building is so pretty inside. I recommend it to anyone that I know is visiting Charlotte :)
Very nice staff. Delicious pastries.  Ambiance was calming. Strawberry danish and raspberry lemon tart was amazing.

The BEST macarons I have ever had! I stumbled upon this place while I was visiting for the ACC games and I was instantly hooked! Once I found out they shipped macarons, I ordered a dozen to ship. While there was an issue with my order, the manager I spoke to was absolutely phenomenal in getting things back in line and they were there the next day on my door step. If you want a delicious treat..try this place!
Wonderful little bakery in uptown Charlotte! Visit them, you won't be disappointed! I had their twice baked almond croissant- super yummy!

I recently visited on Sunday a French bakery nestled in the vibrant heart of downtown, and it was a delightful experience from start to finish. The ambience immediately stood out--unique and fancy, with an elegant charm that made it feel like a little slice of France amid the urban bustle. The decor was sophisticated yet welcoming, striking a perfect balance that elevated the entire visit.

The location couldn't be better; being right in the center of downtown made it a convenient stop amidst a busy day, yet it felt like a serene escape from the surrounding hustle. What truly impressed me, though, was the wide range of options to choose from. Whether you're craving a flaky croissant, a rich eclair, or a perfectly crafted macaron, this bakery has something for every palate. The variety was almost overwhelming--in the best way possible--showcasing authentic French flavors with a modern twist.
Very eclectic bakery and eatery. Very well furnished and dressed. The treats were delicious. Baguette and macarons.

We were hoping to dine at Amelie's French Bakery & Cafe in uptown today and once again, they were out of quiche. You would think they would know the demand they have from their customers so they would make enough to last through the brunch hour on the weekends. However, they don't because this happens all the time. In addition, they were out of chicken salad and also turkey so no Monte Cristo. I asked her what did they have and she basically said not a lot except for the bakery items. She said she wish she had a digital menu board so they could wipe out the items that they didn't have so people would know. That's not a bad idea however, how about trying to be in stock so you can serve your clientele. It's a great place to eat when they have the food. Bummer that we had to leave. Maybe next time.

Waited close to an hour to get an unbaked pre-bake baguette like the plastic wrapped ones you buy at a grocery store and a Napoleon with completely frozen cream. Also sold out of croissants, but I think we lucked out not buying more things.
Amazing food. Friendly staff and great atmosphere.
the cashier was very overwhelming and got our orders completely messed up. i much prefer the other locations.

Amelie's is a short walk from the Kimpton hotel.  It sounded tasty, so I randomly decided to check it out one Saturday afternoon. There were plenty of patrons inside but there was no wait. And still plenty of pastries and treats to choose from.

I tried an oat chai latte, and it was delicious. So good in fact that I walked back over the next morning before we had to hit the road. I also got an almond torte, and it was really sweet. More like a dessert than a breakfast pastry.

The cafe itself had the coolest decor. There were several unique chandeliers made of things like pots and pans and kitchen utensils. There's also a lot of fun artwork. The place is huge too, with what appeared to be multiple levels of seating and plenty of tables.

I'd definitely stop by if I'm in town again. They have a whole menu I need to check out.

The food and vibe of this place are great. However, the service was disappointing. The guy with the ponytail at the checkout counter was passive-aggressive for some reason and wasn't friendly at all. At the end of checkout, it prompts you to join the loyalty program, and I was eager to sign up. However, as I started entering my details, he canceled the screen. Additionally, when I asked him to make my order 'for here,' he ignored my request and made it 'to-go' instead. These small issues really spoiled the mood, and it made it hard to fully enjoy the vibe of the place.

I had the absolute pleasure of enjoying a delicious pastry at Amelie's, and it was nothing short of delightful. The pastry was perfectly baked--flaky, rich, and bursting with flavor in every bite. You can really taste the love and care that goes into their creations.

Beyond the food, the atmosphere at Amelie's is fun, vibrant, and full of charm. The eclectic decor and open, welcoming vibe make it the kind of place where you want to linger. Whether you're catching up with a friend or just enjoying some solo time, it's a space that instantly lifts your mood.

The staff truly sealed the experience for me. Everyone I interacted with was incredibly friendly, warm, and attentive. They made me feel genuinely welcome and taken care of from the moment I walked in. Amelie's isn't just a cafe--it's an experience, and I can't wait to go back.
Love this place

A relaxed french cafe with a great selection of cakes and pastries and good coffee. Especially good when you need to work and be productive in a chill ambience. I ordered fruit tarts and almond cake both were excellent!
Picked up coffees and breakfast for a group of 6 on a Saturday morning, everything came out so fast and was so good.

I love the aesthetic of this restaurant, it's very beautiful. In terms of the food though, it was nothing amazing. I've had fruit tarts and cheesecake from Publix that were wayy more exquisite than this place. Don't even get me started on the Strawberry cream cheese danish.. Horrible. Moral of the story, a grocery store can out French the "French"

We often go to the Pineville Matthews road location. Today we were in uptown and stopped at this location. The restaurant, at its original location (unfortunately lost to rezoning) as well as the one off park road and the one on P-M road, are known for the drinks and food offerings -especially pastries, as well as the friendly staff.
The same one both counts is true of the uptown locale.
Yet, the big difference (and both my wife and felt the same) is that the uptown locale, because of its size, very high ceilings and lots of open spaces, as well as a very monochrome color scheme, did not give us the same "cozy bistro feeling" that the other ones give. It felt "cold" for lack of a better word.
In this respect, we found it lacking. In every other aspect, it was the same good Amelie's fare and service we have come to know and enjoy.
Easy to get to, parking readily available nearby, prices on par for the area. Good coffee, good food, god service.
Very friendly staff. Delicious coffee & pastries. Cute ambience.
Quirky and fun. Soup and sandwich was perfect for lunch.

I had mint mocha and creme brulee. They were good but not "the best I ve eaten." Luckily, I asked for half sweet and my mocha was still sweet to my taste. The coffeeshop is cool and well-decorated. Several cosplayers were in the coffeeshop, not sure if it s normal or there was a cosplay event nearby. Like the other reviews, I cleaned table/chair myself but tips were asked upfront at the cashier.
My favorite backery and coffee spot in charlotte. Always a good time to go with good items and environment!
let me just say, Zack/Zach (one of the managers) if you see this... your the reason i WILL be coming back. i have a gluten allergy and i felt SO SAFE and so seen, so loved. amazing experience.
Amelie's throughout the area have did a marvelous job bringing an amazing product to market with a great presentation!

Amelie's has been around for years and quality has stayed consistently amazing! I don't go often since it's a bit pricey but when I do get it, omg I missed out on my life. During my last visit I got the crookie. I didn't know it existed until I got there.
Picture a chocolate chip
Cookie baked in a croissant dough! It was soooo good! My friend got some gluten free options which is always a plus!

Had the biscuit. It was served room temperature. The biscuit was fresh but the sausage patty and egg seemed like they were premade hours earlier. The coffee was okay. Overall flat experience for the money.

My matcha had chunks of powder and an oily consistency. Not good at all. Customer service was great while ordering though. But I came for the beverage so one star.
I've had a better experience at other locations. Maybe today was an off day.

The place is pretty cool, the desserts are delicious. Carrot cake 9/10, salted caramel 20/10, peanut butter 7/10, we tip 18% at cashier but we had to look for a way to clean and whipe out table bc was very dirty. But everything else good

Amazing. Stopped in for a quick lunch and pastry. Had half a chicken salad sandwich and soup. Both were good just not a fan of leeks. I was a little disappointed they were out of soups and croissants in the middle of the lunch rush. Then came the pastries. We had an assortment of macrons, tarts and THE most amazing creme brule. The desserts were so good we forgot to even take pictures. They were busy but the line moved fairly quickly. Price point is in line with a boutique Cafe/patisserie but not overly expensive. Quirky decor and adequate seating makes a busy place seem not so crowded. Will definitely return.
I love the inviting atmosphere and the food was delicious!
Probably one of the best monte cristos I've had. Would definitely recommend it.
We ordered two sandwiches. Very average and salty. Small portion and seemed like cheap, store bought deli meat. Definitely, not worth it. Atmosphere nice. Didn't try the desserts. Service good.

Holy Moly, Macaroon! If you like dessert, come here!

If not, find a friend, get a big Ole hugarooski, and then come here and get the best dessert of your life!
Beautiful and unique place with amazing desserts and a fun atmosphere!
Amazing pastries!
Great!!
if you look in the photos, I posted a picture of the mess they gave me. A huge disappointment.
Low food quality
Going through a completely abandoned overground mall and ending up here is like a really great acid trip

Interesting place that brings a bit of French culture but in an American style. Super tasty sweets, we ordered 4 items and none of them disappointed. I especially loved the Apple cobbler mini tart and the chocolate petit gateau.
I loved the decor and the museum feel it has with different models of chandeliers on the ceiling, mirrors on some walls and paintings. Very different and pleasant. I think it's a perfect stop for a coffee and a sweet between visits to the museum or after an event nearby.
Even though there were quite a few people here, it didn't seem crowded or loud at all. Delicious pastries and coffee.
The chicken salad wad delightful on the fresh, flaky croissant.

Great vibes, amazing decor, and delicious sweets. A fantastic hangout spot in the middle of downtown to work, relax or catch up with a friend. I only got the napoleon but I'll definitely be back to try their other offerings!

This is a long one...
First obvious context. When I review I consider 3 elements of my experience: atmosphere, service and food. Less obvious, I have worked across the street from Amelie's for more than 10 yrs, and I LOVE French foods, and honestly, I'm not that hard to please. You'll have to trust me on this because after reading this review you will doubt me.

Sadly, Amelie's consistently disappoints me. My biggest gripe is with their ordering, food collection process - it's confusing and customers end up asking each other questions ("where are the napkins?" You'll find them across the wide open space far from the cutlery) because the staff seems oblivious to the general confusion and doesn't set or manage expectations. A few years ago they did a process and space  remodel, but alas, it's still confusing.

Nonetheless, the food used to lure me in despite this frustration with process and staff's oblivion. But even that has become 'meh'- not the pasties mind you they are amazing--  Sometimes heated halfway through, sometimes flavors fall short.

Fortunately for me and my French-food-obsession there are multiple French restaurants in and around CLT.  One that excels where Amelie's flops, is Chez Marie Patisserie in South Park. They also have amazing pastries, and win on service, attitude and food as well. Plus it's a darling little space to sit and enjoy life. I don't work there, I don't know anyone who works there, I'm just a fan of their sunny spot.

The bakery treats are endless! The worst part is making a decision on what treats to try.
The staff are upbeat and helpful. We ordered a make your own sandwich (bacon, ham, raspberry jam, and cheddar on a baguette), the kale salad with chicken and zesty vinaigrette, a creme brulee, and make your own lemonade (strawberry).
You order at the counter and find seating in the fabulously funky dining area or take your food to-go (our choice). Highly recommend!!
Very cute bakery, great decor and esthetic. We tried several mini tarts and some cookies. Everything was delicious! Likely the best sugar cookie I've ever had. You won't be disappointed.
This place is all hype.  The coffee is not good and the pastries are not authentic.
Everything was absolutely fantastic. The staff was super friendly and even gave a couple recommendations when we couldn't decide. The macarons and the fruit tart are to die for
It's an excellent ambiance of French bakeries. I highly encourage everyone too try them at least once!
So cute inside, and our breakfast was amazing. Large portions and close to the conference center
My wife and I stopped in this past week. The desserts were absolutely delicious and the staff were great too! The best French bakery I've been to. Can't wait to come back!

The coffee is superb, the service fabulous.
A special shout out to 'Savanna(h)' for being the perfect host/ server.
Friendliest staff. Can't wait to enjoy all my goodies! Thanks yall!

Amelie's Uptown is an excellent French Bakery, with great food, service, and a French like atmosphere.

I don't remember all of what I tried, but I do recall that I drank hot chocolate, and that was good. The chocolate croissant was also exceptional, and so was the sandwich.

Overall, this is a favorable restaurant if you want to eat French food for breakfast or lunch.
So Good! The food, the drinks, the friendly staff  everything I picked tasted amazing. Spacious and inviting. The inside looks like its own museum of art. Check it out for the pastries and drinks.

I am not a big sweets person but everything I got (chocolate croissant, Oreo PB cake thing (100/10!), cheesecake pastry, tiramisu, cookie dough macaron) was absolutely delicious. The location has a really cute vibe with the decor and seating. Will 100% be going back next time I'm in town.
This place is so beautiful & perfect to be relaxing.

Your cashier made a condescending remark when I left a dollar tip on a coffee and pastry that was overpriced. The small coffee looked like a child's size cup yet was the price of what most other places would charge as a medium. The danish was stale, asked for it to be warmed up but by the time my coffee came out it was cold. Atmosphere feels like I'm at a French themed Disney restaurant. Kinda dystopian. Bad vibe, bad food, would skip.
Very cute. Small with few food selections.
French toast average. Coffee burnt taste. Good service.
Doesn't look or taste like authentic French baked goods. Cheese Danish was cripsy and didn't have too much cream cheese, is how I like it too. Macarons are alright.

Good chocolate gateaux. Had rich chocolate taste.
Chocolate tart so so.
Coffee, not good.
Good ambiance

This place is amazing!! From the food, to the service, to the atmosphere (highly recommend).  They have a wide selection of French pastries and desserts as well as plenty of breakfast and lunch options.  The inside is decorated beautifully.  It's a nice place to have brunch with friends or even to sit down alone on a lunch break or to do some work.
We stopped here on Christmas Eve. We had the chicken and pesto and monte Cristo. Both were EXCELLENT. We will definitely visit again.
Lives up to the hype
Love this location! Open late and always have vanilla eclairs available  also the lavender syrup for the coffees

Yummy food.  The chicken pot pie soup
Was amazing.
Really good!

Amelie's is a local gem. The quirky and fun atmosphere makes for an adorable dine-in experience. The deserts, pastries, coffee, and service have always been amazing.
10/10 recommend whether you are a visitor of Charlotte or a local dropping in for a morning coffee.

Lov this location since they open! Awesome environment, delicious dark roasted coffee! The Soups and souffles are my fav ones so yummylicious!

Large variety of sweet to choose from.

Parking lot is not one of his strengths so if you can't find a spot in front of their location next to Amelie's the  parking lot building next to it will save you. You pay btw Usd10.00 to Usd20.00
Big plastic chairs are painful. Birthday eclare.   only buy blueberry muffins
Wonderful cafe with pasties and coffee. We liked it so much - we visited twice during our short visit to Charlotte.
Just ok. American style French bakery. Large warehouse vibe and feels worn and dirty. Workers feel transient. Bathrooms closed when there. There was a pet dog inside .

Saw this place online as a must go French bakery in Charlotte.  Went there and got some pastries, etc.   Decided to get a baguette ucasue why not? At a French bakery may as well get a baguette.   It was pretty sad.  Ended up throwing away 3/4 of it.

Wife scarfed a Napoleon and a Latte that she liked so I'll assume the baguette was just not the thing to order

One of my favorite places for a snack. Some of the pastries are overpriced but well worth it and you get the entire experience. Hands-down, the beginning and cheese biscuit is the best I've ever had. I discover new artwork every time I go there.
Their pastries are delicious and they have a large variety to choose from.

My first time in Charlotte, the first hours after landing and the first place I entered to grab a bite. The guys at the counter were very friendly and helpful. Adam helped me to choose my drink and pastry and even treated me to a slice of delicious caramel brownie once he learned that it's my first time in Charlotte. That was so nice of him and just a small gesture made my short stay in this beautiful city even more enjoyable. The place is specious and full of antiques. Very unique cafe and experience. Thank you!
The turkey bacon monte cristo is amazing!

Very Terrible Service. They even cannot get the right customer 's name though i said 3 times and spelled every letter of the name and they still wrote and then called a totally irrelevant wrong name and the wrong coffee name. How could they treat a customer so badly with a bad attitude?
Food was very good but on one sandwich it was made on a croissant but it was supposed to be a wrap. Had to get it redone.
Pastries were great
This is my favorite spot however not my location, most of their pastries weren't labeled and the staff was kinda rude (maybe the person in charge)
Great place for sweets and treats.
Both my French toast and my husband's breakfast sandwich were COLD. And for reference, it's a Sunday Monday, not that busy, and we dined in.

La comida muy mala, lo re calientan y se humedece. Nada frances.
Las mesas sucias y un intenso olor a detergente limpiador.

I've heard this was a place to visit and I've been now been to this location twice (once on a weekday, once on the weekend). Both times were before noon. Everything i've tried to order off the menu (non bakery) was sold out. How is it sold out before noon? No soup, not enough ingredients to make the sandwiches etc. It's frustrating! They are on the pricier side but some of their bakery items are delicious!! The actual inside of this location is really cool and makes the visit an experience. Also, both times i went, their coffee (two different types) were both burnt and gross. I figured the first time was a fluke but the second time just confirmed i wont be back. The parking is also not great. Staff was super friendly and pleasant though.
Hot chocolate is pretty good here.And the ambiance is just all perfect!
Great place to buy little tarts to take as dessert for a dinner party!

First time at this location. Much bigger venue than any of the other locations i have been to. Big open space with plenty of seating options to choose from. Of course, they have their well-known quirky decor all over. We arrived around 10:30 am. on a Sunday and didn't officially sit down to down our coffee and food until about 11:20am. There was a huge line, and they had run out of a bunch of pastries and flavors of macaroons by the time we got to the front. Ordered a vanilla latte with a breakfast wrap. $20 for two items, which was thought of was very overpriced. The coffee was delicious, but i would not spend $10 on the breakfast wrap. Very bland, the potatoes were cut up in really BIG chunks, and they were cold, so they were very hard to chew. Overall, the wrap was cold and not flavorful at all. Other than that, all the employees were friendly and efficient. The ambiance was great and quiet for a Sunday coffee run. It is located in uptown, and there is a parking deck located right beside the establishment.

First time back since reopening and this is the worst food experience I've had. Prices went way up and quality is way down. Would no longer recommend.

I had the turkey and Brie sandwich that used to come on a baguette, now it's on a store-bought sliced bread (my store has better bread) and the Brie was nowhere to be found. Leek soup was meh although I used to like it. Pastries were soggy, and the Pumpkin Spice Latte was not even in the same league as Starbucks's. Paid 40 bucks for it, worse lunch I've ever had.
we had never even heard of the place, we asked a person walking by for a suggestion. it was a good suggestion

This place is so nicely designed and has a great menu, it's HUGE though and has a lot of customers and is very busy so not great for anything quick. When I went in over the summer they seemed to be understaffed and a bit stressed, but working together as best they could. I'd probably go the NoDa location just to avoid the crowd.
It's really pretty but the coffee was a bit cold

I am not sure how this place has so many good reviews. It gives Alice in wonderland vibes but not in a good way, looks like they went to a thrift store and bought everything they could that had a Paris theme and missed the mark for cool eclectic vibe.
Our food order was wrong and they wouldn't take it back. Sandwiches were cold, very dissatisfied. Coffee order was also incorrect.
No French vibes found here.

Ordered a Creme Brulee and a Tiramisu latte. The latte was delicious, the creme brulee was good too, but the ambiance was the best! Lovely quaint shop with gorgeous chandeliers. Enjoyed looking around and taking some pictures!
Absolutely amazing loved the soup and sandwich .
We've been going to amelie's for years and it's never been a bad experience. Food is excellent, staff is nice and friendly and the decor is clean and trendy.
Cannot more highly recommend. Excellent food, atmosphere and service.
Great vibe & food!
Not impressed with the food at all. Low quality white bread, chicken with no taste, average soup. Cheap ingredients! Not a good place to get healthy and tasty food for lunch.
This is the Alice in wonderland of cafe's. I love how whimsical it is and how great their pastries are! The French dip was exceptional and their bread is to die for if you're a lover of breads.
The reason for the 1 is $3.50 for tea in the South in a plastic cup with no refills but coffee does get refilled. Even in Asheville with the disaster they use bottled water with refills
Interesting cafe and good food
Wonderful piece of Paris in Charlotte
Just amazing!  Be sure you try the twice baked almond croissant!
By far the best coffee I have ever had and the cutest place with unique decor and chandeliers
Great pastries, sandwiches, and coffee!

It's quite an experience to go to Amelie's. First of all, the atmosphere is amazing.  The restaurant is quite literally filled with decorations that reflect the French culture like a partial Eiffel Tower, Napoleon portraits,  macaroons hanging from the ceiling, a Mona Lisa painting, etc. The seating is very unique.  We sat around a table with a lighted tree in the middle.  There is so much art on the walls that it is like being in the Louvre. The food was delicious, fresh, and flavorful.

This place is popular for their pastries which look good although I didn't try them. We tried having breakfast here and it was complete crap! If you want a pastry fine but don't waste your time on their breakfast.

So the last time I went to amalies was 6 years ago somewhere around Noda I think they had a location but this is close to my apartment so I decided to come here for a coffee. The last time I was at amelies i remember having the most delicious coffee and enjoying the atmosphere. The atmosphere is absolutely beautiful in this location as well  and the vibes are very happy from the customers. The line was long but it moved quickly. The guy who packaged my pumpkin cheesecake macaron was nice and so was the girl at the register. I also got a salted caramel mocha. The lady who was making the drinks seemed a little stressed, I could feel her vibe since it was an open kitchen. She seemed a little busy while also answering the phone. I paid to put whipped cream and caramel drizzle in my drink as well but she didn't and I didnt really feel like asking her to redo it since she redid the lady's drinks before me apparently they weren't right as well. I think she could use another person in her corner for help on a Saturday morning so she is not overworked and stretched thin. But my coffee was still delicious and the macaron was great. I think you guys should get cuter cups to go with esthetic as well.

Beetje stugge bediening aan de balie die niet tegen een grapje in het Frans konden.

Ruime zaak met veel keuzes maar wel Amerikaans prijzig. Voor een simpele wrap en soep $ 24,- betaald.

We were unhappy with our breakfast here.  For 33 dollars, plus the tip they wanted for self-service, the brioche french toast was thin and dried-out and barely edible.  The breakfast sandwhich was just okay.  Even the macaroon was just okay.  Only bother to go here for the coffee.

Amazing spot you must visit while in Uptown.  The pastry selection was unreal. Food, coffee, and dessert were all top notch.  The atmosphere is truly something special, with so much to see.  Do yourself a favor and stop in!
bussin
Out of expresso at a coffee shop is like going to a gas station with no gas. Sa la Vie
Always happy to stop in and get the best variety of Macarons that exist.  They are the fluffiest and sweetest treat after a long day!
Delicious macaroons, melts in your mouth. Great and friendly service. Would come back and recommend
Mediocre sandwich size for $7

I think this place is a classical American tourist trap: nice deco[u]r for a public that buys European experience, but food and coffee quality are of medium scale. This business model doesn't work in Europe, and, frankly, I am not positive about its' future here either...
Always delicious.  One of the best bakeries in downtown.

If you have a craving for an eclair, this will do. It won't be the best ( not enough cream filling, too much sugar) and the place itself is not so clean and quite tacky, but again, if you miss the experience of a French bakery, Amelie's is better than supermarket fare.
I went here after brunch for the 1st time and had the most amazing brownie cheesecake mini tart. One of the best dessert I have ever from a restaurant.  Will definitely be back.
So glad it's reopened!

Fun decor, great coffee, Mediocre quiche. I could look around the Cafe all day and still find something new. The caramel Cafe mocha was beyond good and slightly less than Starbucks expense. Was salivating over quiche and was essentially served a quiche like pizza...cheese should be IN quiche and ON pizza...alas, it was good enough
Always great coffee, they are so welcoming and glad you came in. The decorations and lights always amaze me. Thanks for the great coffee
Yummy treats and decent coffee. Good atmosphere and right in the heart of uptown

My absolute favorite uptown treat. The expertly prepared pastries are as delicious as they are beautiful. Coffee is amazing. And customer service is exceptional and so friendly. A must do in Charlotte!
them brownie batter macarons??? Amazing. 10/10. The staff were also so nice and welcoming. Nice place to get some work done/study and chill. This was my first time, I definitely will be back!
This a great place to have a solo date or meet up with friends. The atmosphere is amazing and the good even better. The macaroons.... mmm mmm mmm!!!

I went her for a nice warm drink and something to satisfy my sweet tooth after brunch in the area, and this place did not disappoint. You are asked to scan the QR code outside the door for the menu and the drink that I wanted was apparently a seasonal beverage, but the lady was so kind to make it for me anyway and it definitely hit the spot. The shop is so nice and cute with the way it is decorated. Definitely will be back
Wheelchair  accessible entrance and bathrooms, very eclectic style of decorations and the cuisine is fantastic

I have been to every Amelie's location; every location is unique and has their own characteristic trait that makes it special. But I definitely love the chandeliers in the uptown location.

I think I have tried almost every dessert they have to offer; each one has never disappointed me. This trip I tried the key lime tart. I'm not sure if the tart was a day old or so but it just didn't taste fresh. It did have that classic Keylime flavor. I also had a turkey sandwich on sourdough bread with spinach. It satisfied my hunger after walking uptown most of the afternoon.

Customer service is always great. Employees are always very friendly.
quality food at a great value...tasted very authentic and did not disappoint...pastries we tried were simply delicious

Quick drop in at the end of the day. I think it's best to show up early and get fresh baked goods. The pistachio coconut latte was unique. My brioche cinnamon bun was dry. Again most likely due to being close to closing time.
Such a cute place in Charlotte. There was a line in Saturday but it moves very quickly. Great for a quick breakfast or a dessert and coffee. There's room to sit outside as well which was lovely
Awesome authentic french food and pastries.
What a wonderful spot.  Coffee was some of the best and the almond croissant was tasty.

My zhdali poka nam nal'iut kholodnyi chai 15! minut. Ego dazhe gotovit' ne nado, prosto nalit', no barista- ne speshil. Khotia my i ostavili na kasse khoroshie chaevye - ne delaite etogo!
Dva pirozhennykh i kholodnyi chai oboshiolsia pochti 20$.
Limonnyi tart byl obychnym, krem-briule nevkusnyi.
S potolka kapala voda priam na menia.
Mesto interesnoe, no ne ukhozhennoe.
Vtoroi raz siuda prikhodit' ne za chem.
Best French bakery and the best bakery in the United states. This bakery is even better than 85 degrees and Paris baguette in Southern California where I came from.

An amazing cafe & pastries shop. Everything was delicious. A cute adorable setup. Service were good but, could be a little more patience. Prices were reasonable. Otherwise I had a great experience and enjoyed here as if I were in Paris years ago.
I love the atmosphere!! Well designed. Just love it! We got pecan and my fav macarons . Very delicious. We had very good time

Amelie's is a fun place to have a quick meal, pastry or coffee. The atmosphere is immersive down to the French music being played. The soup and salad I had were not exceptional, but definitely good enough. The pastry I had was excellent.
Love this place to death. Wish it was closer! The staff sweet, the desserts yummy and the coffee some of the best me and my significant other have ever had. You must go!!!!!!
Delicious
Great bakery! Wasn't sure what to try so got a variety. Mini tarts, pecans pull apart and macaroon.

Absolutely disgusting place. When I was a server we would be fired for trying to kick people out 10 minutes before we closed. We got there at 4:20. They closed at 5:00. The told us to leave at 4:50 and took a chair from a 87 year old lady who can not stand. If I was the owner I would not want my business ran by these employees. What happened to good service?

Nice place and good food! Don't dare go past the red window to request a modification be made to your order! Perhaps they need a sign, "Employee' only" instead of "Sir, you can't be back here!"  Should call in the the "thin red line".
Great vibe walking in, and Kolbi's kind service made it even more enjoyable! Very tasty and amazing to have breakfast options in the neighborhood in the afternoon for us late risers!

This place is an absolute delight! So whimsical  The food was so fresh and tasty and holy moly the marcons were like flavor-blasted little clouds.

There's plenty of seating, both indoor and outdoor. The vibe is like a mad-hatter tea party in all the best ways, with mismatched tables and chairs and cottegecore decor everywhere.
It's like falling into Wonderland & I loved it! The food was delicious, the atmosphere was fun, and the staff was so friendly.

Good pastries! Kids loved them. Beautifully decorated! Huge place!
Drinks weren't good though.
This bakery was super cute. I had the breakfast sandwich, chocolate croissant, and caramel iced coffee. Everything was great and they have a wide variety of pastries to pick from!

Cool spot downtown. Food is pretty bad. Got the tiramisu, which turned out to be like a thawing custard...thing? The strawberry lemonade was pure syrup, and the coffee was pretty much waffle house. Tartine with tomato basil was  plain white breat with cheese that was microwaved and soft/soggy

Good and bad. Coffee was too sweet and tasted artificial. Food was cold. The french dip sandwich barely had roasted beef. French toasts were cold too. The place is really cool gave me Alice in wonderland vibes. Service was good but they got my name wrong for the order. For me it's was a one time thing.
Food was tasty
Cierra muy temprano 5pm
The place had the best macarons I've ever had. I highly recommend the peanut butter jelly macaroon. The place was very spacious and well themed, even the bathroom was on theme!
I really like the way it's decorated, it's a very unique look. The bakery is pretty clean and the food is pretty good as well.

Amelie's Uptown French Bakery and Cafe is a fantastic spot with amazing pastries and sandwiches. The fun atmosphere adds to the charm of this delightful bakery. Tried the creme brulee and the Chocolate Eclair, and both were absolutely delicious. If you're in the area, this place is a must-visit for a delightful French treat!
Such a great little gem to have found! Loved the atmosphere and the macarons were amazing! Plus it's connected to a Boba Tea Shoppe and the combination was just *chef's kiss*
I got a croissant, tart, and caramel brownie which were all very good. This place looks very cool inside. I think it's worth the price
French Nostalgia Bakery Design With Excellent Customer Service And Freshly Baked Treats !

Really great atmosphere to crab a quick lunch or sweet snack. Chicken salad is delicious. My friends ordered eclair and mini chocolate cake and they both raved about them. Service was quick. Plenty of seating.  Bathrooms are well maintained. I would definitely go back.
Soooooo good.
Refused service as they were "closed for an event". There was no one in the store. Won't be getting money from me
Charming, quirky and delicious!

Update 7.25.24 - Just recently returned to work in uptown Charlotte after being away for over 3 years.  Was nice to see that Amelie's is still here.  But today after ordering a turkey wrap I feel like I got robbed.

Dry wrap, could barely find the turkey and feel like I was just eating a lettuce sandwich!!!  Not the quality that I have come to expect from Amelie's.

Look at picture.....where the hell is the turkey?

The ambiance in this bakery was pretty awesome! It's super clean & they offer a variety of different desserts & pastries. The staff was super nice! I purchased several different desserts; however, the products were pricey & didn't taste half as good as they looked. This was my first visit, and I'm pretty certain it was also my last.

Above perfection
Decadent
This is a cool bakery and cafe with a funky aesthetic conveniently located in Downtown Charlotte. Good food and coffee!

Checked out this famous French bakery in Charlotte everyone's been talking about. The place has this quirky, unique vibe with tons of seating and even space for group parties.

We went for the croissant, Key Lime Tart, and another Tart (can't remember the other tart we got, oops), and the Bacon, Egg and Cheese Biscuit. Pretty typical French bakery stuff - a bit rich and sweet.

Honestly, the food was good, but the real star was the atmosphere. There's so much to look at while you're eating, it's like a mini adventure. Definitely what sets this place apart.

Solid spot for breakfast - we left happy and full!
Great coffee! Great pastries! Amazing food!
Very unique place, the decor is amazing. Really spacious interior, plenty of places to sit and enjoy. Croque Monsieur croissant sandwich was delicious, Cafe Au Lait was excellent.
Excellent espresso and macarons! The lavender lemon macaron may be the best one I've ever eaten. The atmosphere is serene and the decor is fun.
The pastry was fresh light and delicious. Staff was pleasant and ready to help....excellent experience

I was there for an event in the private dining.  Food was great, patisserie was delicious.
For normal dining though it's all kind of queued lines and order at the counter. No dining service although there was a decent dining area.
It looked like a place that changed from being a sit down restaurant bakery to a grab and go post-covid restaurant.
I would still recommend it for breakfast, but it isn't a served dining experience
The store is a branch location, so it doesn't have a wide variety of items. However, the products they do have are of good quality and the staff is friendly.
Cool, vibrant space with great baked goods and breakfast choices

Stopped in as we were passing through. We were hoping for cheesecake as advertised but instead we got a "brownie cheesecake" that was nothing more than a very hard, cold brownie that crumbled into pieces once you bite down.  It was even too hard to cut with a fork!  There was nothing "cheese cake" about it!  Disappointed.  I would not recommend going by the Google ad for Amelie's.  It's not accurate.

French??? If you love negative space (upon entering) and dry/try to resemble a French pastry and a quiche that has a layer/topping of cheese this is your place. Upon ordering the breakfast wrap, the response was sorry, we are out of potatoes, OK....so how about your yogurt granola, sorry we're out of yogurt OK... I gave it one star for their coffee, but then how can you go wrong with a push button coffee machine? C'est la vie.

Looking for a delightful breakfast spot in Uptown Charlotte? Look no further than Amelie's French Bakery & Cafe! This hidden gem is a true diamond in the rough, offering delicious pastries, fast service, and a charming atmosphere.

This place has been here a while and they have some really good food and beverages.
Great experience except for the person making Drinks on Sunday 6/23 around 2pm. No personality and that detracts from the overall experience.
Lekker eten en drinken overdag

Incredible food in a tres magnific setting.  I thoroughly enjoyed the spinach asparagus leek soup and salad, so much so that I went back for more the next day!  The gluten free caramel brownie was scrumptious and so was the chai.  Decent prices.  Counter Service.  Gluten free options.
Dining here transported me back to my trip to Paris. Great food and ambience.

A oublier tres vite... Pas de service, plats du petit dejeuner insipide, une ambiance "cantine" et la deco tres kitsch qui se veut "d'inspiration francaise". Bref, une caricature mais ou de surcroit les produits ne sont vraiment pas top : oeufs du petit dejeuner secs, pain au chocolat (a 4 US) avec une pate non feuilletee a fort gout de levure et en sous cuisson, etc,etc...
Passez votre chemin et ne vous fiez pas aux commentaires positifs qui ne voient pas vraiment la realite du produit !
Great spot for coffee and breakfast! Brought home a lot of pastries.
Been here a few times and the food and staff are really great. Also the atmosphere is fun as well! Definitely recommend the celery seed dressing if you get a salad. Yum.
Helpful customer service, clean, quiet, inviting.
Tasty, fun, fast and affordable! This is one of the best Bakeries I've ever been to. The interior decor is incredibly charming and there's plenty of seating. The staff is friendly and helpful.
Nice pastries and ambiance, staff though always appear overwhelmed.
They run out of croissants way to quick and are not prepared for the late morning rush. But when you are able to get one, they are divine!
Their chicken salad on a baguette was immaculate.
The atmosphere was really good, I loved the DJ and vibes this place gave me.
The atmosphere alone is worth it, which is particularly enjoyable on a slow day. The coffee and pastries are also top notch. Recommended stop for anyone visiting Charlotte.

What a gem! They bake on site, the people are nice and patient, and the decor is so much fun! They even have a guest book to sign.

The pastries are fantastic!

I ordered a lemon bar and a small fruit tart. The tart was delicious but the lemon bar was lacking. The base of it was hard and almost gummy, and I had to force my fork through it just to break pieces off. I wouldn't discount this cafe, though, it just seems like I ordered the worst thing off an otherwise great menu.

We loved our cafe lattes and fresh chocolate croissants!   And just as wonderful were the beautiful, whimsical decor and lively French music.  There are 3 floors of fabulous seating options all surrounded by lovely and fun artwork, friendly staff and a very nice assortment of pastries.  We also selected a box of colorful macarons to bring to our hosts for dinner at their home that evening.  Everyone enjoyed them!  This bakery is a must  for all visitors to Charlotte or residents

Great place to grab some brunch and pastries. Super flavorful and at an okay price point for its location downtown. It does get pretty busy on the weekends and the parking is not so great. So be prepared to walk a little, or pay to park. Or just drive around a bit, people will leave and you can park right outside. There's inside ama outside dining, both areas are great and enjoyable.
Cute gem in uptown Charlotte. Macarons and key lime pies were both so AMAZING

Dude this place is amazing!!! Ben at the front was very friendly and helpful with telling me what each pastry taste like and he was so patient with me. Those fresh fruit tarts are divine and I'm so grateful for his recommendation. Can't wait to come back and try a different one!

Breakfast was spectacular. And the pastries were delicious as well. I ordered the brioche French toast with berries and loved every bite. I went back after lunch and ordered two of the tarts to go. The key lime tart was the perfect sour & sweet ratio.
Hey yo, I loved the Lavender Iced Coffee.  It was delicious.
Went to a family wedding brunch this morning and everything was amazing!!  Great food, great service, and wonderful atmosphere!!  Definitely recommend!
The closest to France I'll probably ever get! The drinks were good, the cheese was amazing.
Pricey for portions, but definitely try the salted caramel brownies.

The tarts are the best thing! Especially the mini tarts- they're the perfect little bite!
Everything else was yummy but not to die for.
Delicious food and quick service. The baked goods are particularly nice, I was partial to the Macarons.
Pretentious. Rude staff. Food is overpriced and quality is sub par.
One of my favorite spots in Charlotte. I wish they kept the chicken pot pie soup year round!
Adorable little spot and it had great coffee and delicious treats what more can you want?! I felt like I was in a movie
Amazing dessert and service, the staff are super helpful and friendly.

This is a fun place and it is big inside. We split a $6 piece of cake. The black coffee is about the same price as an espresso drink. The French theme seems to be the pastries? Lots of eclectic art and furniture pieces.
Fantastic! Best French bakery you'll find in the South.
Charming atmosphere. The food was decent. I got the French dip sandwich, was it amazing? No. It was lacking..... je ne sais quo.
Best macarons in town!

We had the tiramisu, a few macaroons, salted caramel brownie, creme brulee everything was the best thing
I've ever tasted

We ordered a decorated cake over the phone and the staff member was helpful and pleasant. When we picked it up, it looked lovely, just like the website picture.  No one enjoyed eating it, though, saying it was "slightly edible" and "not as good as a boxed cake from the supermarket".
Wonderful pastries and coffee with friendly helpful staff and a great atmosphere!

Unbelievably slow making the coffee so out of boredom you eat the croissant beforehand albeit it's very good.   If you have hours to spend waiting for your morning coffee this is the place, if not look elsewhere.

The coffee was ok and the food menu looked typical for a cafeteria-style coffee shop.

People seemed to like it, especially families, but the atmosphere was a bit off...the interior design wanted to be quirky Parisian but it felt like I was in the proper room for a community theatre...

On the plus side, the wifi was good and bathroom was clean!
Amazing food and service. The atmosphere is very nice and relaxed.
The breakfast biscuit was a bland, the chocolate croissant was lacking, the strawberry cheese croissant was just okay.  The coffee was good.

A cute little cafe with a very charming and quirky atmosphere! The staff is very friendly and wonderfully LGBTQ friendly, the prices are reasonable, and the food is good! I highly recommend the pecan pull-apart.
Inviting. Food options typical of French bakery.

This place is a real example of our recent times "A not remarkable food experience within a place that is amazingly decorated and fully inspiring for social network photos" ... do not go here if you are looking for a great French food but if you want to take photos :)
I enjoyed the atmosphere.
Over priced and nothing special about the bakery!

Great place to have a coffe, bread, "macarronis" and something more, location so strategic at downtown of Charlotte and the local is spectacular decorated. I liked this City, I hope to know more next time.
The atmosphere is great, and the food is good.
Good food, horrendously slow. Not well equipped for peak times
So cute
This was a charming little place. I would definitely try it again. The food is very good..
Not too many options for coffee, but wonderful pastries. The vibe is a 10/10 with quirky historical references / decorations!!

Discovered the place while driving through the city, very happy with the choice. Finally got to have great coffee on my week long trip, thank you so much! Pastry was delicious especially the pecan pie, I regret choosing a small one, I should have gotten the larger one.

I ordered the chicken salad and I just didn't care for it. The quiche wasn't ready to serve for half an hour longer. We were preparing to leave Charlotte to travel home and waiting wasn't possible. The atmosphere was nice and really very cool! We enjoyed the creme brule, though!

I can get nitpicky about french cuisine and my daughter has high expectations for macarons. We were disappointed. The highlight was the atmosphere. The eclectic mix of stereotypical french things was cute. Lots of american fare with some traditional french items. The search continues...
Great service and food

Experienced the worst service on Saturday, April 6th. The guy "for pastries" was loud, annoying and  careless, no care about the customers. The girl on the register looked like "I am sick of all of you, leave me alone", didn't listen and never asked if I am in reward program, and when I mentioned it, it was too late for her. The guy who made coffee gave me a paper cup when I had clearly asked for a mug.
By 3 pm they didn't have pastries left, empty counters. A long line of customers, the staff tried to manage it, but lost quality of service completely.
Very unique and distinctive place to enjoy authentic french bake plus good desert and coffee latte or lovely espresso. Highly recommended. Also fine selection of traditional french sandwich
I ordered the Tuxedo cake for a celebration. It was one of the best chocolate cakes I ever had. All of their pastries are amazing!
Excellent and authentic French pastries and baked goods. Wonderful sandwiches and great coffee! Service was excellent and atmosphere very cool. A gem in the heart of Uptown Charlotte.

I ordered my late to have it with mug and enjoy with the almond croissant, the guy who made the late handed me with a to go cap instead of a mug which I preferred to have my latte with, and when I told him I ordered it with a mug, he told me all the mugs are dirty and with take it or leave it attitude. I was so upset and I told him again I want my coffee with a clean mug, he grab the dirty cup and pore my late into it and he handed me the rest with the cup. So unprofessional and disrespectful. I don't recommend it at all.
